importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, marking the conclusion of the ALCS and the start of the World Series.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series in Toronto.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which the Toronto Blue Jays experienced a significant performance turnaround, from a last-place finish in 2024 to finishing 94â€“68 in 2025, and their run to the World Series.
The timeframe during which the Dodgers' postseason run unfolded, including their NLDS and NLCS victories, with key performances in late September and early October.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have won the American League Championship Series, advancing to their first World Series appearance since 1993.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll and a dominant postseason run, are the defending champions and face the Blue Jays in the World Series.
The Blue Jays' comeback in the ALCS, including a 34-run offensive outburst against the Yankees and a seven-game series win over the Mariners, reflects a team transformation.
Shohei Ohtani's historic performance in the NLCS, including three home runs and 6.1 shutout innings, is considered one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.
The Dodgers are a stronger defensive and pitching team compared to the Mariners, but their bullpen has been a weakness during the season, creating a potential vulnerability for the Blue Jays.
The World Series will begin on October 24, 2025, in Toronto, with the Blue Jays hosting Game 1.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays won the American League Championship Series and are now in the World Series for the first time in over 30 years, marking a major milestone in their recent history.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending World Series champions and are the primary opponent in the upcoming World Series, having dominated the postseason with strong team and individual performances.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way superstar player for the Los Angeles Dodgers.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani's extraordinary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, including three home runs and a 6.1 shutout innings outing, is highlighted as a defining moment in the Dodgers' postseason success.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the opponents in the ALCS and lost in Game 7, marking their first appearance in a World Series since their franchise was established in 1977.

namedEntities.name: New York Yankees
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in New York, New York.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Yankees were the division rivals of the Blue Jays in the ALDS, and the Blue Jays overwhelmed them with 34 runs over four games, contributing to their ALCS run.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, highlighting the Dodgers' strength in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, indicating the Dodgers' dominance in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key player for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer hit a late three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS, ending the Mariners' hopes and securing the Blue Jays' series win.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman provided commentary after the game, stating the team's resilience and close play was key to overcoming the Mariners in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship series of Major League Baseball.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The culmination of the postseason, where the Blue Jays and Dodgers will face off, with the first game scheduled for October 24 in Toronto.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS, marking their first appearance since 1993. The Blue Jays, who had a dramatic turnaround from a last-place finish in 2024, overcame a strong Mariners team with a 4-3 series victory, including a pivotal three-run home run by George Springer in Game 7. The Los Angeles Dodgers, the defending champions with a massive payroll and a dominant postseason run, including Shohei Ohtani's legendary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, are the opponents in the World Series. Though the Dodgers are strong defensively and in starting pitching, their bullpen has been a weakness, presenting a potential opening for the Blue Jays. Game 1 of the World Series is scheduled for Friday, October 24, in Toronto.
title: Dodgers and Blue Jays Meet in World Series After ALCS Clash
